item.title: Research
item.description: Organizations and Structures of Communication: My work on the effects of communications structures uses text analysis, information theory, and social networks to investigate the relationships between interactions and social structures in conversations, discussions, and other forms of organizational communications. Related Work: (working paper) Schultz, Michael, Leslie DeChurch, and Noshir Contractor. “Embedded Interactions and Selective Disclosure: Network Effects on Conversations aboard Skylab.” (working paper) Schultz, Michael and Jonah Stuart Brundage. “The Transformation of Global Diplomacy: Networks of Diplomatic Missions, 1648-1815.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: I teach courses in statistical and computational methods at both the graduate and undergraduate levels. I also teach a course in economic sociology for undergraduates. In the past, I’ve taught courses in data science for beginners and introductory workshops in both R and python. I also have over six years of experience in consulting on statistical analysis and research design for graduate students and faculty.
